doc.after: Microstructure is defined as the structure of a prepared surface or thin foil of material as revealed by a microscope above 25Ã magnification. It deals with objects in from 100Â nm to few cm. The microstructure of a material (which can be broadly classified into metallic, polymeric, ceramic and composite) can strongly influence physical properties such as strength, toughness, ductility, hardness, corrosion resistance, high/low temperature behavior, wear resistance, and so on. Most of the traditional materials (such as metals and ceramics) are microstructured.
